title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Lion,  from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824
title_raw: Plate Design:  Le Lion,  from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite, on support above image:  Le lion, below image:  Si l'histoire vous interesse je../Voluntiers est-elle longue? [If the story interests you I.../Sure, is it long?]; in graphite, upper right corner of mount:  7
dimensions:
6.3 x 5.8 cm (2 1/2 x 2 5/16 in.), image
20.2 x 15.3 cm (7 3/4 x 6 in.), support
description: Setting in a museum.  A man in a top hat, left foreground, points to a large painting on the wall of a man holding a knife above a lion.  The top hatted man is aksing two ladies, right foreground, if they want an explanation of the painting.  Through a doorway, left rearground, museum visitors view double-hung paintings on the walls.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Lion,  from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink. 
1989-13-42
